headline.main: PRESIDENT FACES DECISION TODAY; Back in Capital, He Will Hear Congress Chiefs' Advice on Neutrality Act Repeal

lead_paragraph: ABOARD THE PRESIDENT'S TRAIN, Oct. 20 -- President Roosevelt will arrive in Washington early tomorrow to face a momentous decision as to whether the loss of eleven American sailors from the torpedoed destroyer Kearny is to lead to far-reaching action, such as a request for complete repeal of the Neutrality Act, or merely to mark another tragic incident in the Battle of the Atlantic.
abstract: Roosevelt to hear legis leaders advice on act repeal
